Package cpsc2150.extendedConnectX.models

Interface IGameBoard

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbsGameBoard, GameBoard, GameBoardMem
    public interface IGameBoard
    IGameBoard

    This Interface will represent all functions for the ConnectXGame

    Invariant:
    c 0 AND c getNumColumns AND pos is not outside the bounds of the Board
    Correspondences:
    maxRCT = 3 AND maxRC = 100 AND maxT = 25

      static int BEGINNING  
      static int maxRC  
      static int maxT  
      static int minRCT

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      default boolean checkDiagWin​(BoardPosition pos, char p)
      Description: This function checkDiagWin sees if the last token placed at pos results in a win
      default boolean checkForWin​(int c)
      Description: This function checkForWin sees if the last token placed in c (column) results in a win this function can call other methods such as checkDiagWin,checkHorizWin,and checkVertWin
      default boolean checkHorizWin​(BoardPosition pos, char p)
      Description: This function checkHorizWin sees if the last token placed at pos results in a win horizontally

      Description: The Function checkIfFree will determine if a column can accept more tokens from a player

      Description: The Function checkTie will see if the game has resulted in a Tie.

      Description: This function checkVertWin sees if the last token placed at pos results in a win vertically
      int getNumColumns()
      Description: The purpose of the getNumColumns() is to return the number of COLUMN's for GameBoard
      int getNumRows()
      Description: The purpose of the getNumRows() is to return the number of ROW's for GameBoard

      Description: The purpose of the getNumToWin() is to return the number of WINNINGTOKENS for GameBoard

      Description: This function whatsAtPos sees whats the current position in GameBoard

    • Method Detail

      • checkIfFree

        default boolean checkIfFree​(int c)
        Description: The Function checkIfFree will determine if a column can accept more tokens from a player
        Parameters:
        c - is the column being passed from GameBoard
        Returns:
        true if the column can accept more tokens false otherwise.
        Pre:
        BEGINNING c COLUMN
        Post:
        c = #c and Returns True if c (a column) can accept tokens Returns False otherwise

      • placeToken

        void placeToken​(char p,
                int c)
        Description: The function placeTokens places designated token into selected column
        Parameters:
        p - is the character token that goes in the column
        c - is the column where the token will be placed
        Pre:
        c 0 and c COLUMN and p ' '
        Post:
        p = #p and c = #c and board[][c] = p

      • checkForWin

        default boolean checkForWin​(int c)
        Description: This function checkForWin sees if the last token placed in c (column) results in a win this function can call other methods such as checkDiagWin,checkHorizWin,and checkVertWin
        Parameters:
        c - is the column where the last token was placed
        Returns:
        true if the column c resulted in the player winning the game. false otherwise
        Pre:
        c 0 and c COLUMN and c = [previously placed token location]
        Post:
        c = #c and Returns True if last token adds with the other consecutive tokens equals WINNINGTOKENS. Returns False otherwise.

      • checkTie

        default boolean checkTie()
        Description: The Function checkTie will see if the game has resulted in a Tie.
        Returns:
        true if there are no free board positions at top of the board false otherwise
        Pre:
        c = [Does not contain a winning player/game]
        Post:
        Returns true if there are no other free position at the top of the game board. Return false otherwise

      • checkHorizWin

        default boolean checkHorizWin​(BoardPosition pos,
                              char p)
        Description: This function checkHorizWin sees if the last token placed at pos results in a win horizontally
        Parameters:
        pos - is the position where the last token was placed
        p - is the player who placed the token at pos
        Returns:
        true if the pos placed by player p has five matching token horizontally, winning the game false otherwise
        Pre:
        BoardPosition pos is the last position of the board placed and p ' '
        Post:
        pos = #pos and p = #p and Returns True if there are five tokens placed horizontally Returns False otherwise

      • checkVertWin

        default boolean checkVertWin​(BoardPosition pos,
                             char p)
        Description: This function checkVertWin sees if the last token placed at pos results in a win vertically
        Parameters:
        pos - is the position where the last token was placed
        p - is the player who placed the token at pos
        Returns:
        true if the last pos placed by player p has five matching token vertically, winning the game false otherwise
        Pre:
        BoardPosition pos is the last position of the board placed and p ' '
        Post:
        pos = #pos and p = #p Returns True if there are five tokens placed horizontally Returns False otherwise

      • checkDiagWin

        default boolean checkDiagWin​(BoardPosition pos,
                             char p)
        Description: This function checkDiagWin sees if the last token placed at pos results in a win
        Parameters:
        pos - is the position where the last token was placed
        p - is the player who placed the token at pos
        Returns:
        true if the pos placed by player p has five matching token diagonally, winning the game false otherwise
        Pre:
        BoardPosition pos is the last position of the board placed and p ' '
        Post:
        pos = #pos and p = #p and Returns True if there are five tokens placed diagonally Returns False otherwise

      • whatsAtPos

        char whatsAtPos​(BoardPosition pos)
        Description: This function whatsAtPos sees whats the current position in GameBoard
        Parameters:
        pos - is the position where GameBoard is currently
        Returns:
        char of the position at the current GameBoard if no marker returns blank space char
        Pre:
        board.getRow 0 and board.getColumn 0 and board.getRow ROW and board.getColumn COLUMN
        Post:
        pos = #pos and board.getRow = #board.getRow and board.getColumn = #board.getColumn and char = [is returned from pos]

      • isPlayerAtPos

        default boolean isPlayerAtPos​(BoardPosition pos,
                              char player)
        Description: This function isPlayerAtPos returns true if player is a indicated position
        Parameters:
        pos - is the position where GameBoard is currently
        player - is the is the current user
        Returns:
        true if player is found pos in Board Position Returns false otherwise
        Pre:
        board.getRow 0 and board.getColumn 0 and board.getRow ROW and board.getColumn COLUMN
        Post:
        pos = #pos and player = #player and board.getRow = #board.getRow and board.getColumn = #board.getColumn #board = board and board = [returns true if player is at the position given]

      • getNumRows

        int getNumRows()
        Description: The purpose of the getNumRows() is to return the number of ROW's for GameBoard
        Returns:
        returns the number of ROWS to GameBoard
        Pre:
        None
        Post:
        getNumRows = ROWS and COLUMN = #COlUMN and ROW = #ROW and WINNINGTOKENS = #WINNINGTOKENS

      • getNumColumns

        int getNumColumns()
        Description: The purpose of the getNumColumns() is to return the number of COLUMN's for GameBoard
        Returns:
        returns the number of COLUMNS to GameBoard
        Pre:
        None
        Post:
        getNumColumns = COLUMN and COLUMN = #COlUMN and ROW = #ROW and WINNINGTOKENS = #WINNINGTOKENS

      • getNumToWin

        int getNumToWin()
        Description: The purpose of the getNumToWin() is to return the number of WINNINGTOKENS for GameBoard
        Returns:
        returns the number of WINNINGTOKENS to GameBoard
        Pre:
        None
        Post:
        getNumToWin = WINNINGTOKENS and COLUMN = #COlUMN and ROW = #ROW and WINNINGTOKENS = #WINNINGTOKENS
